title: How to Make a Pocket Fold Invitation

steps.headline: Choose your pocket fold.
steps.description: Filter by size, color, texture, and finish to find the pocket fold that suits your event.

steps.headline: Choose your invitation card:  Choose a properly sized invitation card with the color, finish, and texture of your choice.
steps.description: For rectangular 5 1/8 by 7 pocket folds, you will need an invitation insert card that is 4 7/8 by 6 7/8 or smaller. For 6 ⁄4 inch (15.9 cm) square pocket folds, you will need an invitation card that is 6 inches (15.2 cm) square or smaller.

steps.headline: Choose your Response Card and Response Envelope.
steps.description: Regardless of the size of your pocket fold, standard four bar response cards and envelopes are suitable.

steps.headline: Choose your Outer Envelope: Many people prefer to match their outer envelope to their response envelope, but this is simply a matter of preference.
steps.description: If you are using a rectangular 5 1/8 by 7 pocket fold, you will need a 5 1/4 by 7 1/4 outer envelope. For square 6 1/4 pocket folds, choose a 6 ⁄2 inch (16.5 cm) square outer envelope.

steps.headline: Print your Invitations, Response Cards, and Envelopes.
steps.description: For sample invitation wording, word templates, and home printing instructions, please visit the sources link. Now you are ready to assemble your pocket fold ensemble!

steps.headline: Adhere your Invitation Card.
steps.description: Your invitation card can easy be adhered to your pocket fold with a standard glue stick or double sided tape. You may insert your card in the flat panel of your pocket fold horizontally or vertically, as preferred.

steps.headline: Fill the pocket.
steps.description: Fill the angled pocket with your response card, response envelope, and any directions, reception cards, or additional contents you may have. That's it! In no time at all, you have assembled a modern, stylish, and organized pocket fold, customized to fit the mood of your event!
